availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas Jones (Trigg County, Kentucky, farmer and juror)

body.p: Trigg County, Kentucky, farmer and juror. Kentucky native. Married to Frances T. Jackson Jones in Trigg County, Kentucky, on October 5, 1831. Father of Julian M. Jones, Silas C. Jones, and Elizabeth C. Jones. Resident in Trigg County in 1840. Owned two enslaved persons in Trigg County in 1840. Farmer in Trigg County in 1850. Owned seven enslaved persons in Trigg County in 1850. Farmer in Trigg County in 1860. Owned nine enslaved persons in Trigg County in 1860. Juror in the Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Thomas B. Wadlington in Caldwell County on December 8, 1860.

ab.bibl:

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, p. 378B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Trigg County Marriages, Film #000321335, p. 38.
